Class Rogue

  • java.lang.Object
    • PlayerCharacter
      • Rogue

  • public class Rogue
extends PlayerCharacter
    This is the Rogue class, which specializes in stealing and will eventually become the ranged attack specialist if the player chooses to equip the rogue accordingly
    Author:
    Matt Hendrick

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class PlayerCharacter

        armorValue, charName, constitution, currency, damage, dexterity, experience, health, intelligence, level, magic, nextLevel, strength, weaponDamage

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Rogue(java.lang.String name, int str, int dex, int con, int mind, int hp, int mp, int lv, int exp, int next, int gold)
      This is the initial stat chart for a new Rogue.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void hide()
      Designed to pretty much be the opposite of the Fighter's Focus Strike, the delay is before the backstab, though the Rogue is also free from targeted effects during the hiding phase.
      void levelUp()
      This is the level up chart for the Rogue.
      private void mug()
      Combines the effects of stealing an item with a normal attack, though there are attack penalties.

    • Method Detail

      • levelUp

        public void levelUp()
        This is the level up chart for the Rogue. Unlike the other classes, the Rogue grants passive party bonuses at higher levels, making it a good idea to keep one in your party.
        Overrides:
        levelUp in class PlayerCharacter

      • hide

        public void hide()
        Designed to pretty much be the opposite of the Fighter's Focus Strike, the delay is before the backstab, though the Rogue is also free from targeted effects during the hiding phase.

      • mug

        private void mug()
        Combines the effects of stealing an item with a normal attack, though there are attack penalties. Future builds may allow upgrades at higher levels to remove this penalty, or lessen it considerably.
